alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 8:32AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Thunderstorms producing heavy rain and minor flooding will impact portions of central Scotland and Clark Counties through 1000 AM CDT... At 828 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy rain producing thunderstorms along a line extending from near Memphis to near Alexandria. Movement was east at 25 mph. 1 to 3 inches have fallen across the area and an additional half to one inch of rain is possible. HAZARD...Heavy rain, minor flooding and lightning SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor flooding of low-lying areas, creeks, streams and urban areas. Locations impacted include... Granger, Wyaconda, Luray, Kahoka, Wayland, Warsaw and Alexandria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Additional rainfall in this area may be enough to cause flash flooding. Pay attention to future statements and possible warnings.
